text.tspan: Nagel T, 2017. What Is It Like to Be a Bat? The Philosophical Review. Vol. 83, No. 4 (Oct., 1974), pp. 435-450.

Dehaene S et al., 2017. What is consciousness, and could machines have it? Science 358.
Odegaard, B et al., 2017. Should a Few Null Findings Falsify Prefrontal Theories of Conscious Perception? The Journal of Neuroscience 37.

Lamme V, 2017. Towards a true neural stance on consciousness. TICS 10.
Leopold DA et al., 1999. Multistable phenomena: changing views in perception. TICS 3(10).
Lumer E et al., 1999. Neural correlates of perceptual rivalry in the human brain. Science 119.
Sterzer P & Kleinschmidt A, 2007. A neural basis for inference in perceptual ambiguity. PNAS 104.
Weilnhammer V., 2013. Frontoparietal cortex mediates perceptual transitions during bistable perception. The Journal of Neuroscience 13.
Knapen T et al., 2011. The Role of Frontal and Parietal Brain Areas in Bistable Perception. The Journal of Neuroscience 31.

Zou J et al., 2016. Binocular rivalry from invisible patterns. PNAS 113.

Corlett P et al., 2019. Hallucinations and Strong Priors. TICS 23.
